        public static double interpolationExponential(double t)
        Compute exponential interpolation.
        f : [0, 1] -> [0, 1]
        f(0)=0
        f(1)=1
        f is strictly increase
        Parameters:
        t - Value to interpolate in [0, 1]
        Returns:
        Interpolated result in [0, 1]

      • modulo

        public static int modulo(int integer,
         int modulo)
        Mathematical modulo.
        For computer -1 modulo 2 is -1, but in Mathematic -1[2]=1 (-1[2] : -1 modulo 2)
        Parameters:
        integer - Integer to modulate
        modulo - Modulo to apply
        Returns:
        Mathematical modulo : integer[modulo]

      • modulo

        public static long modulo(long integer,
          long modulo)
        Mathematical modulo.
        For computer -1 modulo 2 is -1, but in Mathematic -1[2]=1 (-1[2] : -1 modulo 2)
        Parameters:
        integer - Integer to modulate
        modulo - Modulo to apply
        Returns:
        Mathematical modulo : integer[modulo]

      • sign

        public static int sign(double real)
        Sign of a double.
        The answer is like follow table:
        Double is
        Then return
        < 0
        -1
        = 0
        0
        > 0
        1
        Parameters:
        real - Double to have its sign
        Returns:
        Double sign (-1, 0 or 1)

      • sign

        public static final int sign(int integer)

        It returns
        -1 If integer is <0
        0 If integer is 0
        1 If integer is >0
